Elasticsearch:
Separate each host with a comma.
Elasticsearch Additional Hosts.
Can be IP + Port, Just IP, Domain + Port, Just Domain
Examples: 192.168.1.2:9201, 192.168.1.2, mydomain.server.com:9201, mydomain2.server.com
"Elasticsearch":

Elasticsearch:
Enables authentication when connecting to elasticsearch server/servers.
Important: For this to work Elasticsearch needs to be configured to support authentication.
In production
"Elasticsearch": it is advisable to set up a reverse proxy to secure elasticsearch cluster."
column3:
"Enables authentication when connecting to elasticsearch server/servers.
Important: For this to work Elasticsearch needs to be configured to support authentication.
In production
column4: it is advisable to set up a reverse proxy to secure elasticsearch cluster."

Elasticsearch:
The auth plugin to perform authentications.
Note: Only listed plugins are supported.
"Elasticsearch":
"The auth plugin to perform authentications.
Note: Only listed plugins are supported."

Elasticsearch: The auth type to use. Accepts four different options: Basic, Digets, NTLM, Any
"Elasticsearch": "The auth type to use. Accepts four different options: Basic

Elasticsearch: Set search suggestions max size. Default is 10.
"Elasticsearch": "Set search suggestions max size. Default is 10."

Elasticsearch: The completion suggester also supports fuzzy queries - this means, customers can actually have a typo in their searches and still get results back.
"Elasticsearch": "The completion suggester also supports fuzzy queries - this means
column3: customers can actually have a typo in their searches and still get results back."

Elasticsearch:
Leave blank for default value.
Set search suggestions fuzziness. Increase fuzziness to increase suggestions for mispelled terms.
"Elasticsearch":
"Leave blank for default value.
Set search suggestions fuzziness. Increase fuzziness to increase suggestions for mispelled terms."

Elasticsearch:
Comma separated list of fields used when performing searches. If left blank '_all' will be used.
It is possible to boost a particular field by adding '^n' to the field name (where n is a number).
For example name^5, desciption^10 will make description more relevant than name.
"Elasticsearch":
"Comma separated list of fields used when performing searches. If left blank '_all' will be used.
It is possible to boost a particular field by adding '^n' to the field name (where n is a number).
For example name^5
column3: desciption^10 will make description more relevant than name."

Elasticsearch: Search query executed when performing searches. Default is 'Query String'
"Elasticsearch": "Search query executed when performing searches. Default is 'Query String'"

Elasticsearch: Boolean value. Should the queries be combined using dis_max. Default is 'Yes'
"Elasticsearch": "Boolean value. Should the queries be combined using dis_max. Default is 'Yes'"

Elasticsearch: Boolean value. Should term frequency be ignored. Defaults to 'No'.
"Elasticsearch": "Boolean value. Should term frequency be ignored. Defaults to 'No'."

Elasticsearch: Integer value. The maximum number of query terms that will be included in any generated query. Defaults to 25.
"Elasticsearch": "Integer value. The maximum number of query terms that will be included in any generated query. Defaults to 25."

Elasticsearch: The minimum similarity of the term variants. Defaults to AUTO. See the section called “Fuzziness.
"Elasticsearch": "The minimum similarity of the term variants. Defaults to AUTO. See the section called “Fuzziness."

Elasticsearch: Length of required common prefix on variant terms. Defaults to 0.
"Elasticsearch": "Length of required common prefix on variant terms. Defaults to 0."

Elasticsearch: Sets the boost value of the query. Defaults to 1.0.
"Elasticsearch": "Sets the boost value of the query. Defaults to 1.0."

Elasticsearch: Optional. The analyzer that will be used to analyze the text. Defaults to the analyzer associated with the field.
"Elasticsearch": "Optional. The analyser that will be used to analyse the text. Defaults to the analyser associated with the field."

Elasticsearch:
Comma separated value of fields to be analyzed with corresponding analyzer type. Example:
title:snowball,description:snowball,name:standard.
This can also be set on a per-product basis.
Warning! Analysing filterable attributes should be avoided. These are automatically set to 'not_analyzed' for correct faceting in layered navigation.
"Elasticsearch":
"Comma separated value of fields to be analysed with corresponding analyser type. Example:
title:snowball
column4:
name:standard.
This can also be set on a per-product basis.
Warning! Analyzing filterable attributes should be avoided. These are automatically set to 'not_analyzed' for correct faceting in layered navigation."
